intro: Eriosema endlichii, commonly known as the velvetleaf sida, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with opposite, ovate leaves that are covered in fine, white pubescence. Its small, pale yellow flowers are clustered in racemes and bloom during the warmer months. Eriosema endlichii is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
